errors.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters

home.getLocationQuestion: Get prayer times for your current location?
home.enableLocationMessage: Please enable location access in your device settings.
home.enableLocationDescription: Enable location access to get accurate prayer times for your area and never miss a prayer
home.offlineDataAvailable: Prayer times are available offline for today

qibla.calibrationMessage: Move your device in a figure-8 motion to calibrate the compass.
qibla.aligned: You are aligned with Qibla! âœ¨

instructions.step2: Rotate until Kaaba icon points up

errors.permissionDenied: Location permission denied. Please enable location access in your device settings.
errors.locationFailed: Could not get your location. Please check your GPS settings.
errors.magnetometerUnavailable: Compass sensor not available on this device.
errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.

quotes.prayer1: And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow
quotes.prayer2: Successful indeed are the believers who are humble in their prayers
quotes.sharingNotAvailable: Sharing is not available on this device.

quote_1.text: Today is a new beginning, embrace it with hope.
quote_1.author: Quran

quote_2.text: Patience is the key to relief.
quote_2.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_3.text: Remember Me, and I will remember you.
quote_3.author: Quran

quote_4.text: The best of people benefit others most.
quote_4.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_5.text: Indeed, Allah is with those who are patient.
quote_5.author: Quran

quote_7.text: He is with you wherever you are.
quote_7.author: Quran

quote_9.text: Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity.
quote_9.author: Quran

quote_10.text: The believer's strength is in trust in Allah.
quote_10.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_11.text: So truly where there is hardship, there is also ease.
quote_11.author: Quran

quote_12.text: Do good and goodness will come to you.
quote_12.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_13.text: Seek help through patience and prayer.
quote_13.author: Quran

quote_14.text: Your smile to your brother is charity.
quote_14.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_15.text: The Most Merciful shows mercy to the merciful.
quote_15.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_16.text: Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive.
quote_16.author: Quran

quote_17.text: Be patient, for your patience is only by Allah's help.
quote_17.author: Quran

quote_18.text: Good character is the heaviest thing on the Scale.
quote_18.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_19.text: Call upon Me, I will respond to you.
quote_19.author: Quran

quote_21.text: Whoever relieves a believer's distress, Allah will relieve his.
quote_21.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_22.text: Do not despair of the mercy of Allah.
quote_22.author: Quran

quote_23.text: The strong one is who controls himself in anger.
quote_23.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_24.text: Those who believe find rest in remembrance of Allah.
quote_24.author: Quran

quote_25.text: Whoever does good, it is for their own soul.
quote_25.author: Quran

quote_27.text: Allah is the best of planners.
quote_27.author: Quran

quote_28.text: The most beloved deeds are those done consistently.
quote_28.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_29.text: When you are grateful, I will increase you.
quote_29.author: Quran

quote_30.text: Verily, Allah loves those who do good.
quote_30.author: Quran

quote_31.text: The best among you are those with the best character.
quote_31.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_32.text: Peace be upon those who follow guidance.
quote_32.author: Quran

quote_35.text: Be mindful of Allah, and He will protect you.
quote_35.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_36.text: Allah is gentle and loves gentleness.
quote_36.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_37.text: Take one step towards Me, I will take ten towards you.
quote_37.author: Hadith Qudsi

quote_38.text: In the heart there is sadness that only dhikr removes.
quote_38.author: Ibn Taymiyyah

quote_39.text: The best richness is the richness of the soul.
quote_39.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_40.text: Hold to forgiveness and turn away from the ignorant.
quote_40.author: Quran

quote_41.text: The reward of patience is Paradise.
quote_41.author: Quran

quote_42.text: Feed the hungry and visit the sick.
quote_42.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_43.text: Believers are like one body in mutual compassion.
quote_43.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_44.text: Repel evil with what is better.
quote_44.author: Quran

quote_45.text: Love for your brother what you love for yourself.
quote_45.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_46.text: What is with Allah is better and everlasting.
quote_46.author: Quran

quote_47.text: Good words are like a good tree with firm roots.
quote_47.author: Quran

quote_48.text: Give glad tidings and do not repel people.
quote_48.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_49.text: Paradise lies under the feet of mothers.
quote_49.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_50.text: My Lord never errs or forgets.
quote_50.author: Quran

quote_51.text: Whoever humbles themselves for Allah, He will elevate them.
quote_51.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_52.text: Allah loves those who trust in Him.
quote_52.author: Quran

quote_53.text: The best cure is in the Quran.
quote_53.author: Quran

quote_55.text: Do not let hatred make you unjust.
quote_55.author: Quran

quote_56.text: Knowledge is a light that Allah casts into the heart.
quote_56.author: Imam Malik

quote_57.text: Keep your duty to Allah and speak truthfully.
quote_57.author: Quran

quote_58.text: The believers are brothers, so make peace between them.
quote_58.author: Quran

quote_59.text: Whoever is not merciful will not be shown mercy.
quote_59.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_60.text: Every soul shall taste death, then to Us you return.
quote_60.author: Quran

quote_61.text: We created you from earth, to it you return, then brought forth again.
quote_61.author: Quran

quote_62.text: Children are among the flowers of Paradise.
quote_62.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_63.text: The first thing written for the child is their provision.
quote_63.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_64.text: We created man in the best form.
quote_64.author: Quran

quote_66.text: Life is a journey towards the eternal home.
quote_66.author: Imam Al-Ghazali

quote_67.text: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion over all things.
quote_67.author: Quran

quote_68.text: Every day He is in a different state of glory.
quote_68.author: Quran

quote_69.text: Work for this life as if you'll live forever.
quote_69.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote_70.text: This world is a bridge, so pass over it.
quote_70.author: Traditional Wisdom

quote_71.text: The world is green and beautiful, treat it with care.
quote_71.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_72.text: Plant a tree even if the Hour is at hand.
quote_72.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_73.text: The earth has been made a place of prayer for me.
quote_73.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_74.text: Hope in Allah's mercy and work righteousness.
quote_74.author: Quran

quote_75.text: Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
quote_75.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_76.text: Whoever travels a path seeking knowledge, Allah eases their way to Paradise.
quote_76.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_77.text: Read in the name of your Lord who created.
quote_77.author: Quran

quote_78.text: The ink of the scholar is more sacred than the blood of the martyr.
quote_78.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_79.text: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Begin again.'
quote_79.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_80.text: As the seed awaits spring, the soul awaits awakening.
quote_80.author: Rumi

quote_81.text: Renewal comes with gratitude and patience.
quote_81.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_82.text: Allah alternates the night and day for reflection.
quote_82.author: Quran

quote_83.text: Growth requires both sunshine and rain.
quote_83.author: Traditional Wisdom

quote_84.text: Blessed are the trees, for they give and do not take.
quote_84.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_86.text: Look at the sky, the earth, and contemplate creation.
quote_86.author: Quran

quote_87.text: All creation glorifies Allah in its own way.
quote_87.author: Quran

quote_88.text: The changing seasons remind us that nothing is permanent but Allah.
quote_88.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_89.text: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
quote_89.author: Adapted Wisdom

quote_90.text: March brings renewal to the earth and the soul.
quote_90.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_91.text: The patient one achieves what the hasty one misses.
quote_91.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_92.text: Trust in Allah, but tie your camel.
quote_92.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_93.text: The true pilgrim is one whose journey transforms them.
quote_93.author: Rumi

quote_94.text: Prayer is the pillar of religion.
quote_94.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_95.text: Whoever prays Fajr is under Allah's protection.
quote_95.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_96.text: Maintain prayer at the two ends of the day.
quote_96.author: Quran

quote_97.text: Prayer is light, charity is proof.
quote_97.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_98.text: When you stand for prayer, you converse with your Lord.
quote_98.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_99.text: Between man and disbelief is abandoning prayer.
quote_99.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_100.text: The first matter judged on Judgment Day is prayer.
quote_100.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_101.text: The coolness of my eyes is in prayer.
quote_101.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_102.text: Seek help through patience and prayer.
quote_102.author: Quran

quote_103.text: Allah is more joyful at repentance than you would be.
quote_103.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_104.text: The door of repentance is always open.
quote_104.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_105.text: Turn to Allah before you return to Him.
quote_105.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_106.text: Your Lord's mercy outweighs His anger.
quote_106.author: Hadith Qudsi

quote_107.text: Do not lose hope in Allah's mercy.
quote_107.author: Quran

quote_108.text: Who can forgive sins except Allah?
quote_108.author: Quran

quote_109.text: Return to your Lord and submit to Him.
quote_109.author: Quran

quote_110.text: Allah accepts the repentance of those who do evil ignorantly.
quote_110.author: Quran

quote_111.text: O My servants who transgressed, do not despair of Allah's mercy.
quote_111.author: Quran

quote_113.text: When you make a mistake, follow it with a good deed.
quote_113.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_114.text: A sincere repenter is like one who has no sin.
quote_114.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_115.text: The best of sinners are those who constantly repent.
quote_115.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_116.text: Indeed, good deeds remove bad deeds.
quote_116.author: Quran

quote_117.text: The universe is a book written by the pen of God.
quote_117.author: Imam Al-Ghazali

quote_119.text: Reflect on creation, not on the Creator.
quote_119.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_120.text: The signs of Allah are everywhere for those who reflect.
quote_120.author: Quran

quote_121.text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth.
quote_121.author: Quran

quote_122.text: May your deeds be as beautiful as spring blossoms.
quote_122.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_123.text: Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity.
quote_123.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_124.text: The believer's shade on Judgment Day will be their charity.
quote_124.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_126.text: The best charity is that given when you have little.
quote_126.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_127.text: Who will lend Allah a goodly loan?
quote_127.author: Quran

quote_128.text: Whatever you spend, He will replace it.
quote_128.author: Quran

quote_129.text: Protect yourself from the Fire even with half a date.
quote_129.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_130.text: Every act of kindness is charity.
quote_130.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_131.text: The upper hand is better than the lower hand.
quote_131.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_132.text: Give to the near of kin their due.
quote_132.author: Quran

quote_133.text: Be a garden, not a graveyard.
quote_133.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_134.text: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than they seek.
quote_134.author: Adapted Wisdom

quote_135.text: The green color relaxes the soul.
quote_135.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_136.text: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain?
quote_136.author: Quran

quote_137.text: And We made from water every living thing.
quote_137.author: Quran

quote_138.text: Water is the source of all life.
quote_138.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_139.text: In the creation of heavens and earth are signs for believers.
quote_139.author: Quran

quote_140.text: All creatures depend on Allah for their sustenance.
quote_140.author: Quran

quote_141.text: Look at the fruits when they bear fruit and ripen.
quote_141.author: Quran

quote_142.text: Growth happens slowly, be patient with yourself.
quote_142.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_143.text: The earth is your mother, treat her gently.
quote_143.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_144.text: We have honored the children of Adam.
quote_144.author: Quran

quote_145.text: Honor is in righteousness and faith.
quote_145.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_146.text: Be in this world as if you are a stranger.
quote_146.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_147.text: This world is a temporary abode.
quote_147.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_148.text: Work for the Hereafter as if you die tomorrow.
quote_148.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote_149.text: Every season has its wisdom and purpose.
quote_149.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_150.text: May brings blooming hearts and renewed faith.
quote_150.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_151.text: Thank Allah for the blessings you have.
quote_151.author: Quran

quote_152.text: Summer's warmth is a blessing to embrace.
quote_152.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_153.text: Spend your summer in worship and reflection.
quote_153.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_154.text: Fasting is a shield from sin.
quote_154.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_155.text: Ramadan is the month of blessings.
quote_155.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_156.text: The gates of Paradise are opened in Ramadan.
quote_156.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_157.text: Whoever fasts Ramadan with faith will be forgiven.
quote_157.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_158.text: The du'a of a fasting person is not rejected.
quote_158.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_159.text: Fasting is not just from food, but from bad deeds.
quote_159.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_160.text: There is a gate in Paradise called Ar-Rayyan for those who fast.
quote_160.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_161.text: Lailatul Qadr is better than a thousand months.
quote_161.author: Quran

quote_162.text: The night of power brings immense blessings.
quote_162.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_163.text: Seek Lailatul Qadr in the last ten nights.
quote_163.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_164.text: Ramadan is the month of the Quran.
quote_164.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_165.text: Every breath you take is a step towards death.
quote_165.author: Imam Al-Ghazali

quote_167.text: The Quran is a healing for what is in the hearts.
quote_167.author: Quran

quote_168.text: Recite the Quran for it will intercede for you.
quote_168.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_169.text: The best of you are those who learn and teach Quran.
quote_169.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_170.text: June's warmth is like Allah's mercy, abundant and comforting.
quote_170.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_171.text: Summer days are long for extra worship.
quote_171.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_172.text: Eid brings joy to hearts that fasted with faith.
quote_172.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_173.text: Our Lord, accept from us, You are the All-Hearing.
quote_173.author: Quran

quote_175.text: The reward for fasting is with Allah alone.
quote_175.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_176.text: Break your fast with dates, for they are blessed.
quote_176.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_177.text: The fasting person has a joy at breaking fast.
quote_177.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_178.text: Allah loves those who are consistent in their deeds.
quote_178.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_179.text: After Ramadan, continue in good deeds.
quote_179.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_180.text: The sign of accepted fasting is continued righteousness.
quote_180.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_181.text: Summer is a season of growth in faith and character.
quote_181.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_182.text: July's heat reminds us of the Day of Judgment.
quote_182.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_183.text: Stay hydrated in body and soul.
quote_183.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_184.text: The sun and moon run according to precise calculation.
quote_184.author: Quran

quote_185.text: Pilgrimage to the House is a duty owed to Allah.
quote_185.author: Quran

quote_186.text: Hajj is a journey of a lifetime.
quote_186.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_187.text: The pilgrim returns as pure as the day they were born.
quote_187.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_188.text: Here I am, O Allah, here I am.
quote_188.author: Talbiyah

quote_190.text: The Day of Arafah is the best day of the year.
quote_190.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_191.text: Sacrifice with sincerity brings you closer to Allah.
quote_191.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_192.text: Their meat and blood do not reach Allah, but your piety does.
quote_192.author: Quran

quote_193.text: Eid al-Adha celebrates submission to Allah.
quote_193.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_195.text: True sacrifice is giving up what we love for Allah.
quote_195.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_196.text: The days of Dhul Hijjah are the most blessed.
quote_196.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_197.text: Good deeds done in these ten days are most beloved to Allah.
quote_197.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_198.text: Fast on the Day of Arafah if not performing Hajj.
quote_198.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_199.text: Takbir fills the air with divine remembrance.
quote_199.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_200.text: Allah is the Greatest, All praise belongs to Him.
quote_200.author: Takbir

quote_201.text: July teaches us about heat and patience.
quote_201.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_203.text: The righteous will be in shade on a day with no shade.
quote_203.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_204.text: Small consistent deeds are better than large sporadic ones.
quote_204.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_205.text: Build your paradise deed by deed.
quote_205.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_206.text: The believer is never satisfied with good until Paradise.
quote_206.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_207.text: Compete with each other in good deeds.
quote_207.author: Quran

quote_208.text: July's long days are opportunities for extended worship.
quote_208.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_209.text: Time is like a sword, use it or it will cut you.
quote_209.author: Islamic Proverb

quote_210.text: Your time is your life, spend it wisely.
quote_210.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_211.text: Every moment is a chance to draw closer to Allah.
quote_211.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_212.text: The month ends, but good deeds continue.
quote_212.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_213.text: August brings harvest of summer's spiritual efforts.
quote_213.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_214.text: Unity among believers is a source of strength.
quote_214.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_215.text: The hand of Allah is with the community.
quote_215.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_216.text: Hold fast to the rope of Allah, all together.
quote_216.author: Quran

quote_217.text: And do not dispute, lest you lose courage.
quote_217.author: Quran

quote_218.text: None of you believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
quote_218.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_219.text: The believers, in their love and mercy, are like one body.
quote_219.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_220.text: The believers are brothers, make peace between them.
quote_220.author: Quran

quote_221.text: Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed.
quote_221.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_222.text: A Muslim is a brother to another Muslim.
quote_222.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_223.text: The best house is one where an orphan is treated well.
quote_223.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_224.text: Show mercy to those on earth, and the One above will show mercy to you.
quote_224.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_225.text: Kindness is a mark of faith.
quote_225.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_226.text: The strong bonds of family are a blessing.
quote_226.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_227.text: Maintain ties of kinship, for it increases your lifespan.
quote_227.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_228.text: The one who severs family ties will not enter Paradise.
quote_228.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_229.text: Visit your relatives even if they do not visit you.
quote_229.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_230.text: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his guest.
quote_230.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_231.text: The best of you are the best to their families.
quote_231.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_232.text: Paradise lies at the feet of your mother.
quote_232.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_233.text: Your father is your best gate to Paradise.
quote_233.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_234.text: Treat your children with kindness and fairness.
quote_234.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_235.text: The rights of neighbors are emphasized in Islam.
quote_235.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_236.text: He who sleeps with a full stomach while his neighbor is hungry is not a believer.
quote_236.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_237.text: Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face.
quote_237.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_238.text: The most beloved people to Allah are those most beneficial to others.
quote_238.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_239.text: Whoever removes a worldly hardship from a believer, Allah will remove from him one of the hardships of the Day of Judgment.
quote_239.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_240.text: August's abundance reminds us to share with others.
quote_240.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_241.text: Give and you shall receive manifold.
quote_241.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_243.text: As summer ends, reflect on the growth achieved.
quote_243.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_244.text: September signals autumn's wisdom and change.
quote_244.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_245.text: Change is the only constant, embrace it with faith.
quote_245.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_246.text: The fall of leaves teaches us about letting go.
quote_246.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_247.text: Every ending is a new beginning.
quote_247.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_248.text: Muharram marks the beginning of the Islamic year.
quote_248.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_249.text: Start the new year with renewed intentions.
quote_249.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_250.text: A new Islamic year is a time for renewal.
quote_250.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_251.text: Reflect on the past year and plan for the next.
quote_251.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_252.text: The first month of the year is sacred.
quote_252.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_253.text: In Muharram, renew your commitment to Allah.
quote_253.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_254.text: The Day of Ashura is the tenth of Muharram.
quote_254.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_255.text: Fasting on Ashura expiates the sins of the previous year.
quote_255.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_256.text: Fast the Day of Ashura and differ from the Jews by fasting a day before or after.
quote_256.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_257.text: Ashura commemorates the day Allah saved Moses.
quote_257.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_258.text: Historical events teach us valuable lessons.
quote_258.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_259.text: Remember the trials of the prophets and be patient.
quote_259.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_260.text: Ashura is a day of great significance.
quote_260.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_261.text: Be grateful for every blessing, big or small.
quote_261.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_263.text: If you are grateful, I will surely increase you.
quote_263.author: Quran

quote_264.text: Thank Allah in times of ease and hardship.
quote_264.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_266.text: Count your blessings, not your problems.
quote_266.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_267.text: A thankful heart is a magnet for miracles.
quote_267.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_268.text: Show gratitude through action, not just words.
quote_268.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_269.text: The one who does not thank people does not thank Allah.
quote_269.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_270.text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
quote_270.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_271.text: September's lessons prepare us for the year ahead.
quote_271.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_272.text: Autumn teaches us that change can be beautiful.
quote_272.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_273.text: As leaves fall, let go of what weighs you down.
quote_273.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_274.text: October's balance of light and dark teaches equilibrium.
quote_274.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_275.text: Seek balance in all aspects of life.
quote_275.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_276.text: We have made you a balanced nation.
quote_276.author: Quran

quote_277.text: Moderation is key to a fulfilling life.
quote_277.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_278.text: Balance work and worship, this world and the next.
quote_278.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_280.text: The middle path is the best path.
quote_280.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_281.text: Your body has rights over you.
quote_281.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_282.text: Your family has rights over you.
quote_282.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_283.text: Your Lord has rights over you.
quote_283.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_284.text: Balance brings peace to the heart.
quote_284.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_285.text: October reminds us to prepare for colder days.
quote_285.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_287.text: Prepare for tomorrow by doing your best today.
quote_287.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_288.text: Reflect on the past to build a better future.
quote_288.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_289.text: Take account of yourself before you are taken to account.
quote_289.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

quote_290.text: Prepare for winter as you prepare for the Hereafter.
quote_290.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_292.text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
quote_292.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_293.text: The examined life is a life of growth.
quote_293.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_294.text: Contemplation is the lamp of the heart.
quote_294.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_295.text: Reflect on the blessings you've been given.
quote_295.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_296.text: Think deeply about the creation of the heavens and earth.
quote_296.author: Quran

quote_298.text: October's falling leaves teach us about letting go.
quote_298.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_299.text: Let go of grudges and embrace forgiveness.
quote_299.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_300.text: Change of seasons is a sign for those who reflect.
quote_300.author: Quran

quote_301.text: In the alternation of night and day are signs.
quote_301.author: Quran

quote_302.text: Observe the world around you and see Allah's signs.
quote_302.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_303.text: Nature is the art of God.
quote_303.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_304.text: As October ends, prepare your heart for winter's lessons.
quote_304.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_305.text: November's chill reminds us of life's tests.
quote_305.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_306.text: Tests come in many forms, face them with patience.
quote_306.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_307.text: Difficulty is often a blessing in disguise.
quote_307.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_308.text: We test you with good and bad as a trial.
quote_308.author: Quran

quote_309.text: Do not wish for trials, but if they come, face them with faith.
quote_309.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_310.text: Check on your neighbors, especially in cold times.
quote_310.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_311.text: The best neighbor is the one who is best to their neighbors.
quote_311.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_312.text: Care for those in need around you.
quote_312.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_313.text: Warm your heart even when the weather is cold.
quote_313.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_314.text: Compassion warms the coldest of days.
quote_314.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_315.text: Feed the hungry and clothe those in need.
quote_315.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_316.text: Give charity, for it extinguishes sins.
quote_316.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_317.text: The believer's shade on the Day of Judgment will be their charity.
quote_317.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_318.text: Visit the sick, for it increases blessings.
quote_318.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_319.text: Whoever visits a sick person is in the harvest of Paradise.
quote_319.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_320.text: November teaches us to care for one another.
quote_320.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_321.text: Help carry the burdens of your brothers and sisters.
quote_321.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_322.text: The best deeds are those that bring comfort to others.
quote_322.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_323.text: Endurance is strength of the heart.
quote_323.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_324.text: Endure hardship with grace and patience.
quote_324.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_325.text: The patient will be given their reward without account.
quote_325.author: Quran

quote_327.text: Keep moving forward, even if slowly.
quote_327.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_328.text: Winter is a test of endurance and faith.
quote_328.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_329.text: The cold of winter purifies like the trials of life.
quote_329.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_331.text: In winter, fasting days are short and prayer nights are long.
quote_331.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_332.text: The cold weather is a blessing for worship.
quote_332.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_333.text: November's darkness makes the light of faith shine brighter.
quote_333.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_334.text: As November ends, strengthen your resolve.
quote_334.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_335.text: December brings the year to a close with reflection.
quote_335.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_336.text: Reflect on the year that has passed.
quote_336.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_337.text: What did you accomplish this year?
quote_337.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_339.text: Evaluate yourself before the Day of Evaluation.
quote_339.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_340.text: Account yourself before you are accounted.
quote_340.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

quote_341.text: Weigh your deeds before they are weighed.
quote_341.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

quote_342.text: The wise person is the one who holds themselves accountable.
quote_342.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_343.text: Did you grow closer to Allah this year?
quote_343.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_344.text: Measure your success by your spiritual growth.
quote_344.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_345.text: Success is not in wealth, but in faith.
quote_345.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_346.text: True wealth is the wealth of the soul.
quote_346.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_347.text: Seek forgiveness for the year's shortcomings.
quote_347.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_348.text: Repent sincerely and turn over a new leaf.
quote_348.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_349.text: December is a time for renewal and hope.
quote_349.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_350.text: The blessed month of Rabi' al-Awwal approaches.
quote_350.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_351.text: Remember the life and teachings of the Prophet.
quote_351.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_352.text: Follow the Sunnah in word and deed.
quote_352.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_353.text: The Prophet is the best example for humanity.
quote_353.author: Quran

quote_354.text: Love the Prophet by following his example.
quote_354.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_355.text: Send blessings upon the Prophet abundantly.
quote_355.author: Quran

quote_356.text: Whoever sends blessings upon me once, Allah sends blessings upon them ten times.
quote_356.author: Prophet Muhammad ï·º

quote_357.text: December's cold reminds us of the warmth of faith.
quote_357.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_358.text: Faith warms the heart in the coldest of times.
quote_358.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_359.text: The end of the year is a time for gratitude.
quote_359.author: Islamic Reflection

quote_360.text: As the year ends, increase in seeking forgiveness.
quote_360.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_361.text: Ask Allah for a better year ahead.
quote_361.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_362.text: Make resolutions that bring you closer to Allah.
quote_362.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_363.text: Set intentions for spiritual growth in the new year.
quote_363.author: Islamic Wisdom

quote_364.text: Tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet.
quote_364.author: Adapted Wisdom

quote_365.text: End the year with gratitude and begin anew with hope.
quote_365.author: Islamic Reflection

guides.title: Islamic Guides
guides.subtitle: Learn and practice your faith
guides.quranDescription: Read the Holy Quran with translations and tafsir
guides.newToIslamText: Start with the basics and build your knowledge step by step
guides.comingSoonText: This guide is being prepared. Check back later for detailed content.
guides.needHelp: Need more help? Visit our community forum or contact an imam for guidance.
guides.prayerDescription: Complete step-by-step guide to performing Islamic prayer
guides.pillarsDescription: The fundamental acts of worship in Islam
guides.ramadanDescription: Complete guide to the blessed month of Ramadan
guides.hajjDescription: Complete guide to the pilgrimage to Makkah
guides.basicsDescription: Introduction to Islamic beliefs and practices

prayer.cleanBodyDesc: Ensure you have performed ablution (Wudu) before prayer. Your body must be ritually pure.
prayer.cleanPlaceDesc: Pray on a clean surface. Use a prayer mat if needed.
prayer.cleanClothesDesc: Wear clean, modest clothing that covers the awrah (body parts that must be covered).
prayer.facingQiblaDesc: Face toward the Kaaba in Makkah. Use a compass or Qibla app if needed.
prayer.makeIntentionDesc: Silently intend in your heart which prayer you are about to perform. For example: 'I intend to pray Fajr prayer for Allah.'
prayer.takbirDesc: Raise both hands to shoulder or ear level and say 'Allahu Akbar' (Allah is the Greatest). Then place your right hand over your left hand on your chest or navel.
prayer.fatihaDesc: Recite Surah Al-Fatiha (the opening chapter) followed by another surah or verses from the Quran.
prayer.rukuPositionDesc: Bend forward at the waist with hands on knees. Keep your back straight and say 'Subhana Rabbiyal Adheem' (Glory to my Lord, the Most Great) three times.
prayer.sujoodPositionDesc: Place your forehead, nose, both palms, both knees, and toes on the ground. Say 'Subhana Rabbiyal A'la' (Glory to my Lord, the Most High) three times.
prayer.sittingDesc: Sit on your left foot with right foot upright. Place hands on thighs and recite the Tashahud.
prayer.tasleemDesc: Turn your head to the right and say 'Assalamu Alaikum Wa Rahmatullah', then to the left and repeat. This completes your prayer.

wudu.intentionDesc: Intend in your heart to perform wudu for the purpose of purification and prayer.
wudu.bismillahDesc: Begin by saying 'Bismillah' (In the name of Allah).
wudu.washHandsDesc: Wash both hands up to the wrists three times, making sure water reaches between the fingers.
wudu.rinseMouthDesc: Take water in your right hand, rinse your mouth three times, and spit out the water.
wudu.rinseNoseDesc: Take water in your right hand, sniff it into your nostrils, then blow it out using your left hand. Do this three times.
wudu.washFaceDesc: Wash your entire face from the hairline to the chin and from ear to ear, three times.
wudu.washArmsDesc: Wash your right arm from fingertips to elbow three times, then do the same with the left arm.
wudu.wipeHeadDesc: Wet your hands and wipe your head from the forehead to the back of the head and back to the forehead once.
wudu.wipeEarsDesc: Use your index fingers to wipe inside your ears and thumbs to wipe behind your ears.
wudu.washFeetDesc: Wash your right foot up to the ankle three times, making sure water reaches between the toes. Then do the same with the left foot.
wudu.naturalDischargeDesc: Using the bathroom, passing gas, or any discharge from private parts breaks wudu.
wudu.sleepDesc: Sleeping while not seated or leaning against something breaks wudu.
wudu.unconsciousnessDesc: Fainting, losing your senses, or any state of unconsciousness breaks wudu.

pillars.shahadaMeaningDesc: The Shahada is the testimony that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, and Muhammad is His messenger. It is the foundation of Islamic faith.
pillars.fivePrayersDesc: Muslims must perform five obligatory prayers daily: Fajr (dawn), Dhuhr (noon), Asr (afternoon), Maghrib (sunset), and Isha (night).
pillars.charitableGivingDesc: Zakat is an annual charitable contribution of 2.5% of one's wealth to help the poor and needy, purifying one's wealth.
pillars.ramadanFastDesc: Muslims must fast from dawn to sunset during the month of Ramadan, abstaining from food, drink, and marital relations.
pillars.pilgrimageDesc: Hajj is the pilgrimage to Makkah that every able Muslim must perform at least once in their lifetime if they have the means.

duas.morningDuaDesc: Recite this in the morning: 'We have entered a new morning and the kingdom belongs to Allah' - seeking Allah's protection and blessings for the day.
duas.eveningDuaDesc: Recite this in the evening: 'We have entered the evening and the kingdom belongs to Allah' - seeking Allah's protection through the night.
duas.beforeEatingDesc: Say 'Bismillah' (In the name of Allah) before eating to remember Allah's blessings and provision.
duas.afterEatingDesc: Say 'Alhamdulillah' (All praise is for Allah) after eating to thank Allah for the food and sustenance.
duas.travelDuaDesc: Say 'Glory to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could never have it (by our efforts)' when beginning a journey.

ramadan.whoMustFastDesc: All adult Muslims who are physically and mentally capable must fast. Exemptions exist for travelers, the sick, pregnant or nursing women, elderly, and menstruating women.
ramadan.whatBreaksFastDesc: Eating, drinking, smoking, sexual relations, and intentional vomiting break the fast. The fast is from dawn (Fajr) until sunset (Maghrib).
ramadan.suhoorTimeDesc: Eat a pre-dawn meal before Fajr prayer. The Prophet ï·º emphasized the blessings of suhoor and encouraged Muslims not to skip it.
ramadan.iftarTimeDesc: Break your fast at sunset (Maghrib time). It is Sunnah to break the fast with dates and water, following the example of the Prophet ï·º.
ramadan.taraweehDesc: Special nightly prayers performed during Ramadan after Isha prayer. It is Sunnah and highly recommended, often completing the entire Quran over the month.
ramadan.nightOfPowerDesc: The Night of Power, better than a thousand months, likely falls in the last 10 nights of Ramadan, particularly on odd nights (21st, 23rd, 25th, 27th, 29th). Increase worship and seek forgiveness.

hajj.obligationDesc: Hajj is mandatory once in a lifetime for every Muslim who is physically and financially capable. It takes place during the Islamic month of Dhul-Hijjah.
hajj.ihramClothingDesc: Men wear two white unstitched cloths. Women wear modest clothing covering everything except face and hands. Enter the state of ihram with intention at designated locations (miqat).
hajj.ihramRestrictionsDesc: While in ihram, do not cut hair or nails, use perfume, hunt, engage in marital relations, or wear sewn garments (for men). Women should not cover their faces.
hajj.circlingKaabaDesc: Perform tawaf by circling the Kaaba seven times counter-clockwise, starting from the Black Stone. Men may uncover their right shoulder (idtiba) during tawaf.
hajj.safaMarwaDesc: Perform Sa'ee by walking seven times between the hills of Safa and Marwa, commemorating Hajar's search for water for her son Ismail.
hajj.dayOfArafahDesc: The most important day of Hajj (9th of Dhul-Hijjah). Stand in prayer and supplication at Mount Arafah from noon until sunset. Hajj is not valid without this.

basics.tawheedDesc: The core belief that Allah is One, without partners, sons, or equals. He is the Creator and Sustainer of everything, worthy of all worship.
basics.messengersDesc: Muslims believe in all prophets sent by Allah, including Adam, Noah, Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and Muhammad (peace be upon them all). Muhammad ï·º is the final prophet.
basics.divineBooksDesc: Muslims believe in the Torah (Tawrah), Psalms (Zabur), Gospel (Injeel), and Quran. The Quran is the final revelation, preserved in its original form.
basics.angelsRoleDesc: Angels are created from light and serve Allah perfectly. Notable angels include Jibreel (Gabriel) who brought revelations, Mikael (Michael), Israfil, and the Angel of Death.
basics.akhirahDesc: Muslims believe in life after death. On the Day of Judgment, all will be resurrected and judged by Allah. The righteous enter Paradise (Jannah) and the wicked enter Hellfire (Jahannam).
basics.qadrDesc: Muslims believe Allah has knowledge and power over everything. While we have free will to choose, Allah's knowledge encompasses all past, present, and future events.

quran.noBookmarksDescription: Your bookmarked ayahs will appear here
quran.deleteBookmarkConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this bookmark?
